p: Arterial hypertension is among the most frequent comorbidities associated in patients infected with SARS-CoV-2, with an estimated prevalence of 15–30% in most of the studies from China, with a higher value in patients who ultimately had severe COVID-19 infection [ 12, 13, 28–30]. However, these values might be higher due to the likely underreporting of pre-existing conditions in China [ 31]. Importantly, the presence of underlying hypertension may be a risk factor for severe patients compared with non-severe patients, according to a recent meta-analysis of eight studies including 46 248 COVID-19 patients [ 32].
